snippet.title: Fire breaks out at 79-storey Dubai skyscraper
snippet.content: A large fire has ripped through a residential skyscraper in Dubai in the United Arab Emirates. Footage posted on social media sites showed flames spreading up a tower, believed to be the Torch building, and burning debris falling down, reports the BBC. It was not immediately clear what caused the blaze and how many people may currently be in the building. The 79-storey Torch, one of the tallest residential buildings in the world, was damaged by fire in 2015. The Dubai Media Office tweeted that firefighting crews were on the scene and evacuating residents. (C) Nine Digital Pty Ltd 2017
